Value.pm

Go to the documentation of this file.
00001 package Value;
00002 my $pkg = 'Value';
00003 use vars qw($context $defaultContext %Type);
00004 use Scalar::Util;
00005 use strict; no strict "refs";
00006 
00007 =head1 DESCRIPTION
00008 
00009 Value (also called MathObjects) are intelligent versions of standard mathematical
00010 objects.  They 'know' how to produce string or TeX or perl representations
00011 of themselves.  They also 'know' how to compare themselves to student responses --
00012 in other words they contain their own answer evaluators (response evaluators).
00013 The standard operators like +, -, *, <, ==, >, etc, all work with them (when they
00014 make sense), so that you can use these MathObjects in a natural way.  The comparisons
00015 like equality are "fuzzy", meaning that two items are equal when they are "close enough"
00016 (by tolerances that are set in the current Context).
00017 
00018 =cut
00019 
00020 
00021 =head3 Value context
00022 
00023  #############################################################
00024  #
00025  #  Initialize the context-- flags set
00026  #
00027     The following are list objects, meaning that they involve delimiters (parentheses)
00028     of some type.
00029 
00030     lists => {
00031         'Point'  => {open => '(', close => ')'},
00032         'Vector' => {open => '<', close => '>'},
00033         'Matrix' => {open => '[', close => ']'},
00034         'List'   => {open => '(', close => ')'},
00035         'Set'    => {open => '{', close => '}'},
00036     },
00037 
00038     The following context flags are set:
00039 
00040     #  For vectors:
00041     #
00042     ijk => 0,  # print vectors as <...>
00043     #
00044     #  For strings:
00045     #
00046     allowEmptyStrings => 1,
00047     infiniteWord => 'infinity',
00048     #
00049     #  For intervals and unions:
00050     #
00051     ignoreEndpointTypes => 0,
00052     reduceSets => 1,
00053     reduceSetsForComparison => 1,
00054     reduceUnions => 1,
00055     reduceUnionsForComparison => 1,
00056     #
00057     #  For fuzzy reals:
00058     #
00059     useFuzzyReals => 1,
00060     tolerance    => 1E-4,
00061     tolType      => 'relative',
00062     zeroLevel    => 1E-14,
00063     zeroLevelTol => 1E-12,
00064     #
00065     #  For Formulas:
00066     #
00067     limits       => [-2,2],
00068     num_points   => 5,
00069     granularity  => 1000,
00070     resolution   => undef,
00071     max_adapt    => 1E8,
00072     checkUndefinedPoints => 0,
00073     max_undefined => undef,
00074   },
00075 
00076 
00077 =cut
00078 
00079 BEGIN {
00080 
00081 use Value::Context;
00082 
00083 $defaultContext = Value::Context->new(
00084   lists => {
00085     'Point'  => {open => '(', close => ')'},
00086     'Vector' => {open => '<', close => '>'},
00087     'Matrix' => {open => '[', close => ']'},
00088     'List'   => {open => '(', close => ')'},
00089     'Set'    => {open => '{', close => '}'},
00090   },
00091   flags => {
00092     #
00093     #  For vectors:
00094     #
00095     ijk => 0,  # print vectors as <...>
00096     #
00097     #  For strings:
00098     #
00099     allowEmptyStrings => 1,
00100     infiniteWord => 'infinity',
00101     #
00102     #  For intervals and unions:
00103     #
00104     ignoreEndpointTypes => 0,
00105     reduceSets => 1,
00106     reduceSetsForComparison => 1,
00107     reduceUnions => 1,
00108     reduceUnionsForComparison => 1,
00109     #
00110     #  For fuzzy reals:
00111     #
00112     useFuzzyReals => 1,
00113     tolerance    => 1E-4,
00114     tolType      => 'relative',
00115     zeroLevel    => 1E-14,
00116     zeroLevelTol => 1E-12,
00117     #
00118     #  For Formulas:
00119     #
00120     limits       => [-2,2],
00121     num_points   => 5,
00122     granularity  => 1000,
00123     resolution   => undef,
00124     max_adapt    => 1E8,
00125     checkUndefinedPoints => 0,
00126     max_undefined => undef,
00127   },
00128 );
00129 
00130 $context = \$defaultContext;
00131 
00132 }

00134 =head3 Implemented MathObject types and their precedence
00135 
00136  #
00137  #  Precedence of the various types
00138  #    (They will be promoted upward automatically when needed)
00139  #
00140 
00141   'Number'   =>  0,
00142    'Real'     =>  1,
00143    'Infinity' =>  2,
00144    'Complex'  =>  3,
00145    'Point'    =>  4,
00146    'Vector'   =>  5,
00147    'Matrix'   =>  6,
00148    'List'     =>  7,
00149    'Interval' =>  8,
00150    'Set'      =>  9,
00151    'Union'    => 10,
00152    'String'   => 11,
00153    'Formula'  => 12,
00154    'special'  => 20,
00155 
00156 =cut

00158 $$context->{precedence} = {
00159    'Number'   =>  0,
00160    'Real'     =>  1,
00161    'Infinity' =>  2,
00162    'Complex'  =>  3,
00163    'Point'    =>  4,
00164    'Vector'   =>  5,
00165    'Matrix'   =>  6,
00166    'List'     =>  7,
00167    'Interval' =>  8,
00168    'Set'      =>  9,
00169    'Union'    => 10,
00170    'String'   => 11,
00171    'Formula'  => 12,
00172    'special'  => 20,
00173 };
00174 
00175 #
00176 #  Binding of perl operator to class method
00177 #
00178 $$context->{method} = {
00179    '+'   => 'add',
00180    '-'   => 'sub',
00181    '*'   => 'mult',
00182    '/'   => 'div',
00183    '**'  => 'power',
00184    '.'   => '_dot',       # see _dot below
00185    'x'   => 'cross',
00186    '%'   => 'modulo',
00187    '<=>' => 'compare',
00188    'cmp' => 'compare_string',
00189 };
00190 
00191 $$context->{pattern}{infinite} = '[-+]?inf(?:inity)?';
00192 $$context->{pattern}{infinity} = '\+?inf(?:inity)?';
00193 $$context->{pattern}{-infinity} = '-inf(?:inity)?';
00194 
00195 push(@{$$context->{data}{values}},'method','precedence');
00196 
00197 #
00198 #  Copy an item and its data
00199 #
00200 sub copy {
00201   my $self = shift;
00202   my $copy = {%{$self}}; $copy->{data} = [@{$self->{data}}];
00203   foreach my $x (@{$copy->{data}}) {$x = $x->copy if Value::isValue($x)}
00204   return bless $copy, ref($self);
00205 }

00207 =head3 getFlag
00208 
00209 #
00210 #  Get the value of a flag from the object itself,
00211 #  or from the context, or from the default context
00212 #  or from the given default, whichever is found first.
00213 #
00214 
00215     Usage:   $mathObj->getFlag("showTypeWarnings");
00216              $mathObj->getFlag("showTypeWarnings",1); # default is second parameter
00217 
00218 =cut
00219 
00220 sub getFlag {
00221   my $self = shift; my $name = shift;
00222   if (Value::isHash($self)) {
00223     return $self->{$name} if defined($self->{$name});
00224     if (defined $self->{equation}) {
00225       return $self->{equation}{$name} if defined($self->{equation}{$name});
00226       return $self->{equation}{equation}{$name}
00227     if defined($self->{equation}{equation}) && defined($self->{equation}{equation}{$name});
00228     }
00229   }
00230   my $context = $self->context;
00231   return $context->{answerHash}{$name}
00232     if defined($context->{answerHash}) && defined($context->{answerHash}{$name});  # use WW answerHash flags first
00233   return $context->{flags}{$name} if defined($context->{flags}{$name});
00234   return shift;
00235 }
00236 
00237 #
00238 #  Get or set the context of an object
00239 #
00240 sub context {
00241   my $self = shift; my $context = shift;
00242   if (Value::isHash($self)) {
00243     if ($context && $self->{context} != $context) {
00244       $self->{context} = $context;
00245       if (defined $self->{data}) {
00246         foreach my $x (@{$self->{data}}) {$x->context($context) if Value::isBlessed($x)}
00247       }
00248     }
00249     return $self->{context} if $self->{context};
00250   }
00251   return $$Value::context;
00252 }
00253 
00254 #
00255 #  Set context but return object
00256 #
00257 sub inContext {my $self = shift; $self->context(@_); $self}

00263 #
00264 #  The address of a Value object (actually ANY perl value).
00265 #  Use this to compare two objects to see of they are
00266 #  the same object (avoids automatic stringification).
00267 #
00268 sub address {oct(sprintf("0x%p",shift))}

00270 sub isBlessed {Scalar::Util::blessed(shift) ne ""}
00271 sub blessedClass {Scalar::Util::blessed(shift)}
00272 sub blessedType {Scalar::Util::reftype(shift)}
00273 
00274 sub isa {UNIVERSAL::isa(@_)}
00275 sub can {UNIVERSAL::can(@_)}
00276 
00277 sub isHash {
00278   my $self = shift;
00279   return ref($self) eq 'HASH' || blessedType($self) eq 'HASH';
00280 }
00281 
00282 sub subclassed {
00283   my $self = shift; my $obj = shift; my $method = shift;
00284   my $code = UNIVERSAL::can($obj,$method);
00285   return $code && $code ne $self->can($method);
00286 }

00288 #
00289 #  Check if a value is a number, complex, etc.
00290 #
00291 sub matchNumber   {my $n = shift; $n =~ m/^$$Value::context->{pattern}{signedNumber}$/i}
00292 sub matchInfinite {my $n = shift; $n =~ m/^$$Value::context->{pattern}{infinite}$/i}
00293 sub isReal    {classMatch(shift,'Real')}
00294 sub isComplex {classMatch(shift,'Complex')}
00295 sub isContext {class(shift) eq 'Context'}
00296 sub isFormula {classMatch(shift,'Formula')}
00297 sub isParser  {my $v = shift; isBlessed($v) && $v->isa('Parser::Item')}
00298 sub isValue {
00299   my $v = shift;
00300   return (ref($v) || $v) =~ m/^Value::/ || (isHash($v) && $v->{isValue}) || isa($v,'Value');
00301 }
00302 
00303 sub isNumber {
00304   my $n = shift;
00305   return $n->{tree}->isNumber if isFormula($n);
00306   return classMatch($n,'Real','Complex') || matchNumber($n);
00307 }
00308 
00309 sub isRealNumber {
00310   my $n = shift;
00311   return $n->{tree}->isRealNumber if isFormula($n);
00312   return isReal($n) || matchNumber($n);
00313 }
00314 
00315 sub isZero {
00316   my $self = shift;
00317   return 0 if scalar(@{$self->{data}}) == 0;
00318   foreach my $x (@{$self->{data}}) {return 0 if $x ne "0"}
00319   return 1;
00320 }
00321 
00322 sub isOne {0}
00323 
00324 sub isSetOfReals {0}
00325 sub canBeInUnion {
00326   my $self = shift;
00327   my $def = $self->context->lists->get($self->class);
00328   my $open = $self->{open}; $open = $def->{open}||$def->{nestedOpen} unless defined $open;
00329   my $close = $self->{close}; $close = $def->{close}||$def->{nestedClose} unless defined $close;
00330   return $self->length == 2 && $self->typeRef->{entryType}{name} eq 'Number' &&
00331     $open =~ m/^[\(\[]$/ && $close =~ m/^[\)\]]$/;
00332 }

00334 ######################################################################

00336 #
00337 #  Value->Package(name[,noerror]])
00338 #
00339 #  Returns the package name for the specificied Value object class
00340 #  (as specified by the context's {value} hash, or "Value::name").
00341 #
00342 sub Package {(shift)->context->Package(@_)}
00343 
00344 #  Check if the object class matches one of a list of classes
00345 #
00346 sub classMatch {
00347   my $self = shift;
00348   return $self->classMatch(@_) if Value->subclassed($self,"classMatch");
00349   my $class = class($self); my $ref = ref($self);
00350   my $isHash = ($ref && $ref ne 'ARRAY' && $ref ne 'CODE');
00351   my $context = ($isHash ? $self->{context} || Value->context : Value->context);
00352   foreach my $name (@_) {
00353     my $isName = "is".$name;
00354     return 1 if $class eq $name || $ref eq "Value::$name" ||
00355                 ($isHash && $self->{$isName}) ||
00356         $ref eq $context->Package($name,1) ||
00357         (isa($self,"Value::$name") &&
00358            !($isHash && defined($self->{$isName}) && $self->{$isName} == 0));
00359   }
00360   return 0;
00361 }
00362 
00363 =head3 makeValue
00364 
00365     Usage:  Value::makeValue(45);
00366 
00367     Will create a Real mathObject.
00368  #
00369  #  Convert non-Value objects to Values, if possible
00370  #
00371 
00372 =cut
00373 
00374 sub makeValue {
00375   my $x = shift;
00376   my %params = (showError => 0, makeFormula => 1, context => Value->context, @_);
00377   my $context = $params{context};
00378   if (Value::isValue($x)) {
00379     return $x unless {@_}->{context};
00380     return $x->copy->inContext($context);
00381   }
00382   return $context->Package("Real")->make($context,$x) if matchNumber($x);
00383   if (matchInfinite($x)) {
00384     my $I = $context->Package("Infinity")->new($context);
00385     $I = $I->neg if $x =~ m/^$context->{pattern}{-infinity}$/;
00386     return $I;
00387   }
00388   return $context->Package("String")->make($context,$x)
00389     if !$Parser::installed || $context->{strings}{$x} ||
00390        ($x eq '' && $context->{flags}{allowEmptyStrings});
00391   return $x if !$params{makeFormula};
00392   Value::Error("String constant '%s' is not defined in this context",$x)
00393     if $params{showError};
00394   $x = $context->Package("Formula")->new($context,$x);
00395   $x = $x->eval if $x->isConstant;
00396   return $x;
00397 }
00398 
00399 =head3 showClass
00400 
00401     Usage:   TEXT( $mathObj -> showClass() );
00402 
00403         Will print the class of the MathObject
00404 
00405  #
00406  #  Get a printable version of the class of an object
00407  #  (used primarily in error messages)
00408  #
00409 
00410 =cut
00411 
00412 sub showClass {
00413   my $value = shift;
00414   if (ref($value) || $value !~ m/::/) {
00415     $value = Value::makeValue($value,makeFormula=>0);
00416     return "'".$value."'" unless Value::isValue($value);
00417   }
00418   return $value->showClass(@_) if Value->subclassed($value,"showClass");
00419   my $class = class($value);
00420   return showType($value) if Value::classMatch($value,'List');
00421   $class .= ' Number' if Value::classMatch($value,'Real','Complex');
00422   $class .= ' of Intervals' if Value::classMatch($value,'Union');
00423   $class = ($value eq '' ? 'Empty Value' : 'Word') if Value::classMatch($value,'String');
00424   return 'a Formula that returns '.showType($value->{tree}) if Value::isFormula($value);
00425   return 'an '.$class if $class =~ m/^[aeio]/i;
00426   return 'a '.$class;
00427 }
00428 
00429 =head3 showType
00430 
00431     Usage:   TEXT( $mathObj -> showType() );
00432 
00433         Will print the class of the MathObject
00434 
00435  #
00436  #  Get a printable version of the type of an object
00437  #  (the class and type are not the same.  For example
00438  #  a Formula-class object can be of type Number)
00439  #
00440 
00441 =cut
00442 
00443 sub showType {
00444   my $value = shift;
00445   my $type = $value->type;
00446   if ($type eq 'List') {
00447     my $ltype = $value->typeRef->{entryType}{name};
00448     if ($ltype && $ltype ne 'unknown') {
00449       $ltype =~ s/y$/ie/;
00450       $type .= ' of '.$ltype.'s';
00451     }
00452   }
00453   return 'an Infinity' if $type eq 'String' && $value->{isInfinite};
00454   return 'an Empty Value' if $type eq 'String' && $value eq '';
00455   return 'a Word' if $type eq 'String';
00456   return 'a Complex Number' if $value->isComplex;
00457   return 'an '.$type if $type =~ m/^[aeio]/i;
00458   return 'a '.$type;
00459 }
00460 
00461 #
00462 #  Return a string describing a value's type
00463 #
00464 sub getType {
00465   my $equation = shift; my $value = shift;
00466   return $value->getType($equation,@_) if Value->subclassed($value,"getType");
00467   my $strings = $equation->{context}{strings};
00468   if (ref($value) eq 'ARRAY') {
00469     return 'Interval' if ($value->[0] =~ m/^[(\[]$/ && $value->[-1] =~ m/^[)\]]$/);
00470     my ($type,$ltype);
00471     foreach my $x (@{$value}) {
00472       $type = getType($equation,$x);
00473       if ($type eq 'value') {
00474         $type = $x->type if $x->classMatch('Formula');
00475         $type = 'Number' if $x->classMatch('Complex') || $type eq 'Complex';
00476       }
00477       $ltype = $type if $ltype eq '';
00478       return 'List' if $type ne $ltype;
00479     }
00480     return 'Point'  if $ltype eq 'Number';
00481     return 'Matrix' if $ltype =~ m/Point|Matrix/;
00482     return 'List';
00483   }
00484   return 'Formula'  if Value::isFormula($value);
00485   return 'Infinity' if Value::classMatch($value,'Infinity');
00486   return 'Number'   if Value::isReal($value);
00487   return 'value'    if Value::isValue($value);
00488   return 'unknown'  if ref($value);
00489   return 'String'   if defined($strings->{$value});
00490   return 'Number'   if Value::isNumber($value);
00491   return 'String'   if $value eq '' && $equation->{context}{flags}{allowEmptyStrings};
00492   return 'unknown';
00493 }
00494 
00495 #
00496 #  Get a string describing a value's type,
00497 #    and convert the value to a Value object (if needed)
00498 #
00499 sub getValueType {
00500   my $equation = shift; my $value = shift;
00501   return $value->getValueType($equation,@_) if Value->subclassed($value,"getValueType");
00502   my $type = Value::getType($equation,$value);
00503   if ($type eq 'String') {$type = $Value::Type{string}}
00504   elsif ($type eq 'Number') {$type = $Value::Type{number}}
00505   elsif ($type eq 'Infinity') {$type = $Value::Type{infinity}}
00506   elsif ($type eq 'value' || $type eq 'Formula') {$type = $value->typeRef}
00507   elsif ($type eq 'unknown') {
00508     $equation->Error(["Can't convert %s to a constant",Value::showClass($value)]);
00509   } else {
00510     $type = $equation->{context}->Package($type);
00511     $value = $type->new($equation->{context},@{$value});
00512     $type = $value->typeRef;
00513   }
00514   return ($value,$type);
00515 }
00516 
00517 #
00518 #  Convert a list of values to a list of formulas (called by Parser::Value)
00519 #
00520 sub toFormula {
00521   my $formula = shift;
00522   my $processed = 0;
00523   my @f = (); my $vars = {};
00524   foreach my $x (@_) {
00525     if (isFormula($x)) {
00526       $formula->{context} = $x->{context}, $processed = 1 unless $processed;
00527       $formula->{variables} = {%{$formula->{variables}},%{$x->{variables}}};
00528       push(@f,$x->{tree}->copy($formula));
00529     } else {
00530       push(@f,$formula->Item("Value")->new($formula,$x));
00531     }
00532   }
00533   return (@f);
00534 }
00535 
00536 #
00537 #  Convert a list of values (and open and close parens)
00538 #    to a formula whose type is the list type associated with
00539 #    the parens.
00540 #
00541 sub formula {
00542   my $self = shift; my $values = shift;
00543   my $context = $self->context;
00544   my $list = $context->lists->get($self->class);
00545   my $open = $list->{'open'};
00546   my $close = $list->{'close'};
00547   my $paren = $open; $paren = 'list' if $self->classMatch('List');
00548   my $formula = $self->Package("Formula")->blank($context);
00549   my @coords = Value::toFormula($formula,@{$values});
00550   $formula->{tree} = $formula->Item("List")->new($formula,[@coords],0,
00551      $formula->{context}{parens}{$paren},$coords[0]->typeRef,$open,$close);
00552   $formula->{autoFormula} = 1;  # mark that this was generated automatically
00553   return $formula;
00554 }
00555 
00556 #
00557 #  A shortcut for new() that creates an instance of the object,
00558 #    but doesn't do the error checking.  We assume the data are already
00559 #    known to be good.
00560 #
00561 sub make {
00562   my $self = shift; my $class = ref($self) || $self;
00563   my $context = (Value::isContext($_[0]) ? shift : $self->context);
00564   bless {$self->hash, data => [@_], context => $context}, $class;
00565 }
00566 
00567 #
00568 #  Easy method for setting parameters of an object
00569 #  (returns a copy with the new values set, but the copy
00570 #  is not a deep copy.)
00571 #
00572 sub with {
00573   my $self = shift;
00574   bless {%{$self},@_}, ref($self);
00575 }
00576 
00577 #
00578 #  Return a copy with the specified fields removed
00579 #
00580 sub without {
00581   my $self = shift;
00582   $self = bless {%{$self}}, ref($self);
00583   foreach my $id (@_) {delete $self->{$id} if defined $self->{$id}}
00584   return $self;
00585 }

00587 ######################################################################
00588 
00589 #
00590 #  Return the hash data as an array of key=>value pairs
00591 #
00592 sub hash {
00593   my $self = shift;
00594   return %$self if isHash($self);
00595   return ();
00596 }
00597 
00598 #
00599 #  Copy attributes that are not already in the current object
00600 #  from the given objects.  (Used by binary operators to make sure
00601 #  the result inherits the values from the two terms.)
00602 #
00603 sub inherit {
00604   my $self = shift;
00605   my %copy = (map {%$_} @_,$self);  # copy values from given objects
00606   foreach my $id ($self->noinherit) {delete $copy{$id}}
00607   $self = bless {%copy}, ref($self);
00608   return $self;
00609 }
00610 
00611 #
00612 #  The list of fields NOT to inherit.
00613 #  Use the default list plus any specified explicitly in the object itself.
00614 #  Subclasses can override and return additional fields, if necessary.
00615 #
00616 sub noinherit {
00617   my $self = shift;
00618   ("correct_ans","original_formula","equation",@{$self->{noinherit}||[]});
00619 }

00621 ######################################################################
00622 
00623 #
00624 #  Return a type structure for the item
00625 #    (includes name, length of vectors, and so on)
00626 #
00627 sub Type {
00628   my $name = shift; my $length = shift; my $entryType = shift;
00629   $length = 1 unless defined $length;
00630   return {name => $name, length => $length, entryType => $entryType,
00631           list => (defined $entryType), @_};
00632 }

00634 #
00635 #  Some predefined types
00636 #
00637 %Type = (
00638   number   => Value::Type('Number',1),
00639   complex  => Value::Type('Number',2),
00640   string   => Value::Type('String',1),
00641   infinity => Value::Type('Infinity',1),
00642   interval => Value::Type('Interval',2),
00643   unknown  => Value::Type('unknown',0,undef,list => 1)
00644 );
00645 
00646 #
00647 #  Return various information about the object
00648 #
00649 sub value {return @{(shift)->{data}}}                  # the value of the object (as an array)
00650 sub data {return (shift)->{data}}                      # the reference to the value
00651 sub length {return scalar(@{(shift)->{data}})}         # the number of coordinates
00652 sub type {return (shift)->typeRef->{name}}             # the object type
00653 sub entryType {return (shift)->typeRef->{entryType}}   # the coordinate type
00654 #
00655 #  The the full type-hash for the item
00656 #
00657 sub typeRef {
00658   my $self = shift;
00659   return Value::Type($self->class, $self->length, $Value::Type{number});
00660 }
00661 #
00662 #  The Value.pm object class
00663 #
00664 sub class {
00665   my $self = shift;
00666   return $self->class(@_) if Value->subclassed($self,"class");
00667   my $class = ref($self) || $self; $class =~ s/.*:://;
00668   return $class;
00669 }
00670 
00671 #
00672 #  Get an element from a point, vector, matrix, or list
00673 #
00674 sub extract {
00675   my $M = shift; my $i; my @indices = @_;
00676   return unless Value::isValue($M);
00677   @indices = $_[0]->value if scalar(@_) == 1 && Value::isValue($_[0]);
00678   while (scalar(@indices) > 0) {
00679     return if Value::isNumber($M);
00680     $i = shift @indices; $i = $i->value if Value::isValue($i);
00681     Value::Error("Can't extract element number '%s' (index must be an integer)",$i)
00682       unless $i =~ m/^-?\d+$/;
00683     return if $i == 0; $i-- if $i > 0;
00684     $M = $M->data->[$i];
00685   }
00686   return $M;
00687 }
00688 
00689 ######################################################################
00690 
00691 use overload
00692        '+'   => '_add',
00693        '-'   => '_sub',
00694        '*'   => '_mult',
00695        '/'   => '_div',
00696        '**'  => '_power',
00697        '.'   => '_dot',
00698        'x'   => '_cross',
00699        '%'   => '_modulo',
00700        '<=>' => '_compare',
00701        'cmp' => '_compare_string',
00702        '~'   => '_twiddle',
00703        'neg' => '_neg',
00704        'abs' => '_abs',
00705        'sqrt'=> '_sqrt',
00706        'exp' => '_exp',
00707        'log' => '_log',
00708        'sin' => '_sin',
00709        'cos' => '_cos',
00710      'atan2' => '_atan2',
00711   'nomethod' => 'nomethod',
00712         '""' => 'stringify';
00713 
00714 #
00715 #  Promote an operand to the same precedence as the current object
00716 #
00717 sub promotePrecedence {
00718   my $self = shift; my $other = shift; my $context = $self->context;
00719   return 0 unless Value::isValue($other);
00720   my $sprec = $self->precedence; my $oprec = $other->precedence;
00721   return (defined($sprec) && defined($oprec) && $sprec < $oprec);
00722 }
00723 
00724 sub precedence {my $self = shift; return $self->context->{precedence}{$self->class}}
00725 
00726 sub promote {
00727   my $self = shift; my $class = ref($self) || $self;
00728   my $context = (Value::isContext($_[0]) ? shift : $self->context);
00729   my $x = (scalar(@_) ? shift : $self);
00730   return $x->inContext($context) if ref($x) eq $class && scalar(@_) == 0;
00731   return $self->new($context,$x,@_);
00732 }
00733 
00734 #
00735 #  Return the operators in the correct order
00736 #
00737 sub checkOpOrder {
00738   my ($l,$r,$flag) = @_;
00739   if ($flag) {return ($l,$r,$l,$r)} else {return ($l,$l,$r,$r)}
00740 }
00741 
00742 #
00743 #  Return the operators in the correct order, and promote the
00744 #  other value, if needed.
00745 #
00746 sub checkOpOrderWithPromote {
00747   my ($l,$r,$flag) = @_; $r = $l->promote($r);
00748   if ($flag) {return ($l,$r,$l,$r)} else {return ($l,$l,$r,$r)}
00749 }
00750 
00751 #
00752 #  Handle a binary operator, promoting the object types
00753 #  as needed, and then calling the main method
00754 #
00755 sub binOp {
00756   my ($l,$r,$flag,$call) = @_;
00757   if ($l->promotePrecedence($r)) {return $r->$call($l,!$flag)}
00758                             else {return $l->$call($r,$flag)}
00759 }
00760 
00761 #
00762 #  stubs for binary operations (with promotion)
00763 #
00764 sub _add            {binOp(@_,'add')}
00765 sub _sub            {binOp(@_,'sub')}
00766 sub _mult           {binOp(@_,'mult')}
00767 sub _div            {binOp(@_,'div')}
00768 sub _power          {binOp(@_,'power')}
00769 sub _cross          {binOp(@_,'cross')}
00770 sub _modulo         {binOp(@_,'modulo')}
00771 
00772 sub _compare        {transferTolerances(@_); binOp(@_,'compare')}
00773 sub _compare_string {binOp(@_,'compare_string')}
00774 
00775 sub _atan2          {binOp(@_,'atan2')}
00776 
00777 sub _twiddle        {(shift)->twiddle}
00778 sub _neg            {(shift)->neg}
00779 sub _abs            {(shift)->abs}
00780 sub _sqrt           {(shift)->sqrt}
00781 sub _exp            {(shift)->exp}
00782 sub _log            {(shift)->log}
00783 sub _sin            {(shift)->sin}
00784 sub _cos            {(shift)->cos}
00785 
00786 #
00787 #  Default stub to call when no function is defined for an operation
00788 #
00789 sub nomethod {
00790   my ($l,$r,$flag,$op) = @_;
00791   my $call = $l->context->{method}{$op};
00792   if (defined($call) && $l->promotePrecedence($r)) {return $r->$call($l,!$flag)}
00793   my $error = "Can't use '%s' with %s-valued operands";
00794   $error .= " (use '**' for exponentiation)" if $op eq '^';
00795   Value::Error($error,$op,$l->class);
00796 }
00797 
00798 sub nodef {
00799   my $self = shift; my $func = shift;
00800   Value::Error("Can't use '%s' with %s-valued operands",$func,$self->class);
00801 }
00802 
00803 #
00804 #  Stubs for the sub-classes
00805 #
00806 sub add    {nomethod(@_,'+')}
00807 sub sub    {nomethod(@_,'-')}
00808 sub mult   {nomethod(@_,'*')}
00809 sub div    {nomethod(@_,'/')}
00810 sub power  {nomethod(@_,'**')}
00811 sub cross  {nomethod(@_,'x')}
00812 sub modulo {nomethod(@_,'%')}
00813 
00814 sub twiddle {nodef(shift,"~")}
00815 sub neg     {nodef(shift,"-")}
00816 sub abs     {nodef(shift,"abs")}
00817 sub sqrt    {nodef(shift,"sqrt")}
00818 sub exp     {nodef(shift,"exp")}
00819 sub log     {nodef(shift,"log")}
00820 sub sin     {nodef(shift,"sin")}
00821 sub cos     {nodef(shift,"cos")}
00822 
00823 #
00824 #  If the right operand is higher precedence, we switch the order.
00825 #
00826 #  If the right operand is also a Value object, we do the object's
00827 #  dot method to combine the two objects of the same class.
00828 #
00829 #  Otherwise, since . is used for string concatenation, we want to retain
00830 #  that.  Since the resulting string is often used in Formula and will be
00831 #  parsed again, we put parentheses around the values to guarantee that
00832 #  the values will be treated as one mathematical unit.  For example, if
00833 #  $f = Formula("1+x") and $g = Formula("y") then Formula("$f/$g") will be
00834 #  (1+x)/y not 1+(x/y), as it would be without the implicit parentheses.
00835 #
00836 sub _dot {
00837   my ($l,$r,$flag) = @_;
00838   return $r->_dot($l,!$flag) if ($l->promotePrecedence($r));
00839   return $l->dot($r,$flag) if (Value::isValue($r));
00840   if (Value->context->flag('StringifyAsTeX')) {$l = $l->TeX} else {$l = $l->pdot}
00841   return ($flag)? ($r.$l): ($l.$r);
00842 }
00843 #
00844 #  Some classes override this
00845 #
00846 sub dot {
00847   my ($l,$r,$flag) = @_;
00848   my $tex = Value->context->flag('StringifyAsTeX');
00849   if ($tex) {$l = $l->TeX} else {$l = $l->pdot}
00850   if (Value::isBlessed($r)) {if ($tex) {$r = $r->TeX} else {$r = $r->pdot}}
00851   return ($flag)? ($r.$l): ($l.$r);
00852 }
00853 
00854 #
00855 #  Some classes override this to add parens
00856 #
00857 sub pdot {shift->stringify}
00858 
00859 
00860 #
00861 #  Compare the values of the objects
00862 #    (list classes should replace this)
00863 #
00864 sub compare {
00865   my ($l,$r) = Value::checkOpOrder(@_);
00866   return $l->value <=> $r->value;
00867 }
00868 
00869 #
00870 #  Compare the values as strings
00871 #
00872 sub compare_string {
00873   my ($l,$r,$flag) = @_;
00874   $l = $l->string; $r = $r->string if Value::isValue($r);
00875   if ($flag) {my $tmp = $l; $l = $r; $r = $tmp}
00876   return $l cmp $r;
00877 }
00878 
00879 #
00880 #  Copy flags from the parent object to its children (recursively).
00881 #
00882 sub transferFlags {
00883   my $self = shift;
00884   foreach my $flag (@_) {
00885     next unless defined $self->{$flag};
00886     foreach my $x (@{$self->{data}}) {
00887       if ($x->{$flag} ne $self->{$flag}) {
00888     $x->{$flag} = $self->{$flag};
00889     $x->transferFlags($flag);
00890       }
00891     }
00892   }
00893 }
00894 
00895 sub transferTolerances {
00896   my ($self,$other) = @_;
00897   $self->transferFlags("tolerance","tolType","zeroLevel","zeroLevelTol");
00898   $other->transferFlags("tolerance","tolType","zeroLevel","zeroLevelTol") if Value::isValue($other);
00899 }
00900 
00901 =head3 output methods for MathObjects
00902 
00903  #
00904  #  Generate the various output formats
00905  #  (can be replaced by sub-classes)
00906  #
00907 
00908 =cut
00909 
00910 =head4 stringify
00911 
00912     Usage:   TEXT($mathObj); or TEXT( $mathObj->stringify() ) ;
00913 
00914         Produces text string or TeX output depending on context
00915             Context()->texStrings;
00916             Context()->normalStrings;
00917 
00918         called automatically when object is called in a string context.
00919 
00920 =cut
00921 
00922 sub stringify {
00923   my $self = shift;
00924   return $self->TeX if Value->context->flag('StringifyAsTeX');
00925   return $self->string;
00926 }
00927 
00928 =head4 ->string
00929 
00930     Usage: $mathObj->string()
00931 
00932     ---produce a string representation of the object
00933            (as opposed to stringify, which can produce TeX or string versions)
00934 
00935 =cut
00936 
00937 sub string {
00938   my $self = shift; my $equation = shift;
00939   my $def = ($equation->{context} || $self->context)->lists->get($self->class);
00940   return $self->value unless $def;
00941   my $open = shift; my $close = shift;
00942   $open  = $self->{open}  unless defined($open);
00943   $open  = $def->{open}   unless defined($open);
00944   $close = $self->{close} unless defined($close);
00945   $close = $def->{close}  unless defined($close);
00946   my @coords = ();
00947   foreach my $x (@{$self->data}) {
00948     if (Value::isValue($x)) {
00949       $x->{format} = $self->{format} if defined $self->{format};
00950       push(@coords,$x->string($equation));
00951     } else {
00952       push(@coords,$x);
00953     }
00954   }
00955   return $open.join($def->{separator},@coords).$close;
00956 }
00957 
00958 =head4 ->TeX
00959 
00960     Usage: $mathObj->TeX()
00961 
00962     ---produce TeX prepresentation of the object
00963 
00964 =cut
00965 
00966 sub TeX {
00967   my $self = shift; my $equation = shift;
00968   my $context = $equation->{context} || $self->context;
00969   my $def = $context->lists->get($self->class);
00970   return $self->string(@_) unless $def;
00971   my $open = shift; my $close = shift;
00972   $open  = $self->{open}  unless defined($open);
00973   $open  = $def->{open}   unless defined($open);
00974   $close = $self->{close} unless defined($close);
00975   $close = $def->{close}  unless defined($close);
00976   $open =~ s/([{}])/\\$1/g; $close =~ s/([{}])/\\$1/g;
00977   $open = '\left'.$open if $open; $close = '\right'.$close if $close;
00978   my @coords = (); my $str = $context->{strings};
00979   foreach my $x (@{$self->data}) {
00980     if (Value::isValue($x)) {
00981       $x->{format} = $self->{format} if defined $self->{format};
00982       push(@coords,$x->TeX($equation));
00983     } elsif (defined($str->{$x}) && $str->{$x}{TeX}) {push(@coords,$str->{$x}{TeX})}
00984     else {push(@coords,$x)}
00985   }
00986   return $open.join(',',@coords).$close;
00987 }
00988 
00989 #
00990 #  For perl, call the appropriate constructor around the object's data
00991 #
00992 sub perl {
00993   my $self = shift; my $parens = shift; my $matrix = shift;
00994   my $mtype = $self->classMatch('Matrix'); $mtype = -1 if $mtype & !$matrix;
00995   my $perl; my @p = ();
00996   foreach my $x (@{$self->data}) {
00997     if (Value::isValue($x)) {push(@p,$x->perl(0,$mtype))} else {push(@p,$x)}
00998   }
00999   @p = ("'".$self->{open}."'",@p,"'".$self->{close}."'") if $self->classMatch('Interval');
01000   if ($matrix) {
01001     $perl = join(',',@p);
01002     $perl = '['.$perl.']' if $mtype > 0;
01003   } else {
01004     $perl = ref($self).'->new('.join(',',@p).')';
01005     $perl = "($perl)->with(open=>'$self->{open}',close=>'$self->{close}')"
01006       if $self->classMatch('List') && $self->{open}.$self->{close} ne '()';
01007     $perl = '('.$perl.')' if $parens == 1;
01008   }
01009   return $perl;
01010 }
01011 
01012 #
01013 #  Stubs for when called by Parser
01014 #
01015 sub eval {shift}
01016 sub reduce {shift}
01017 
01018 sub ijk {
01019   Value::Error("Can't use method 'ijk' with objects of type '%s'",(shift)->class);
01020 }
01021 
01022 
01023 =head3 Error
01024 
01025     Usage: Value->Error("We're sorry...");
01026            or  $mathObject->Error("We're still sorry...");
01027 
01028  #
01029  #  Report an error and die.  This can be used within custom answer checkers
01030  #  to report errors during the check, or when sub-classing a MathObject to
01031  #  report error conditions.
01032  #
01033 
01034 =cut
01035 
01036 sub Error {
01037   my $self = (UNIVERSAL::can($_[0],"getFlag") ? shift : "Value");
01038   my $message = shift; my $context = $self->context;
01039   $message = [$message,@_] if scalar(@_) > 0;
01040   $context->setError($message,'');
01041   $message = $context->{error}{message};
01042   die $message . traceback() if $self->getFlag('showTraceback');
01043   die $message . getCaller();
01044 }
01045 
01046 #
01047 #  Try to locate the line and file where the error occurred
01048 #
01049 sub getCaller {
01050   my $frame = 2;
01051   while (my ($pkg,$file,$line,$subname) = caller($frame++)) {
01052     return " at line $line of $file\n"
01053       unless $pkg =~ /^(Value|Parser)/ ||
01054              $subname =~ m/^(Value|Parser).*(new|call)$/;
01055   }
01056   return "";
01057 }
01058 
01059 #
01060 #  For debugging
01061 #
01062 sub traceback {
01063   my $frame = shift; $frame = 2 unless defined($frame);
01064   my $trace = '';
01065   while (my ($pkg,$file,$line,$subname) = caller($frame++))
01066     {$trace .= " in $subname at line $line of $file\n"}
01067   return $trace;
01068 }

01074

01088 
01089   use Value::WeBWorK;  # stuff specific to WeBWorK
01090 }
